author: WHAM Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Our overnight storm did not disappoint! A mix of rain and snow made it into the Las Vegas valley!{/p}{p}Lee Canyon is reporting around 8\" of new snow along with3\" of snow in Kyle Canyon, 4\" of snow in Rainbow Canyon and up to 1\" of snow in Anthem. Flakes were also flying in Summerlin with snow sticking in some neighborhoods in Henderson on the edges of town. Rainfall amounts in the valley were very light, measuring around a trace of showers up to .12\".{/p}{p}TODAY: Now that the showers have cleared out, we'll see gusty winds for the rest of the day. A WIND ADVISORY is in effect through 10am for sustained northwest winds 20-30 mph with wind gusts around 45 mph. As winds pick up, areas of blowing dust may be possible especially around construction sites. Breezes will very slowly back down throughout the rest of the day with high temperatures struggling to make it to 50 degrees in Las Vegas. The normal high temperature this time of the year is 58 degrees for some perspective.{/p}{p}Air and pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold around the freezing mark, 32 degrees. Temperatures may be a bit lower on the edges of town.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Much calmer on Friday with mostly sunny skies and valley highs in the low to mid 50s. Temperatures will keep climbing into the weekend as high pressure builds in with highs in the upper 50s by Sunday. A storm system will pass to our north but most of the impacts will be across Northern Nevada Saturday night into Sunday with the storm moving east. The latest storm tracks don't show much impact to Southern Nevada except additional clouds.{/p}{p}On Martin Luther King Jr. Day expect mostly sunny skies with light northeast winds up to 10 mph. 57 degrees by the afternoon.{/p}{p}Temperatures will be on the rise again through the work week with valley highs reaching the low 60s by Wednesday. There's some uncertainty over the weather pattern next week with an outside chance of showers possible late Wednesday... but the odds are around 10%....{/p}{p}In the extended forecast, valley high temperatures appear to stay in the low to mid 60s NEXT Thursday through Saturday.{/p}{p}Check back for Koast{/p}{p}A mayor in New York is calling for an investigation after {a href=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\" //13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\"}a man suffering a medical crisis was asked to leave an ambulance and later died{/a}.{/p}{p}Rochester Mayor Malik Evans held a news conference Thursday to discuss the incident, which happened Nov. 30. The city later released video of the incident.{/p}{p}The video appears to shows a man, who was having trouble breathing, being asked to leave one ambulance and wait on the street for another to arrive and take him to the hospital. The man falls to the sidewalk and waits more than two minutes before medical personnel helped him.{/p}{p}The man died shortly before Christmas, according to Evans, who said he didn't find out about the incident until Tuesday and was \"flabbergasted\" by it. He called on ambulance provider American Medical Response to conduct an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }Even though this was a medical scene, there are always lessons to be learned -- particularly as it relates to what type of ambulance services our medical services our community are experiencing,\" Evans said. \"City residents are people, and they deserve to be treated humanely and with the same attention as anyone else.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Police had been called to the ambulance for a reported assault against an EMT and were present when the man fell. Police Chief David Smith has also called for an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }I want to know why they chose to call the police,\" Evans said. \"I want to know why personnel required someone in distress to be removed from an ambulance instead of being taken directly to the hospital.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}In a statement, the city added AMR \"has committed to working to determine the reasons this incident occurred, address the gaps in the care that was provided to this patient, and fix whatever led to this unacceptable situation.\"{/p}{p}\"We must get to the bottom of this,\" Evans said. \"We must understand how and why this occurred and we must identify processes and safeguards to insure that this does not ever happen again.\"{/p}{p}Our overnight storm did not disappoint! A mix of rain and snow made it into the Las Vegas valley!{/p}{p}Lee Canyon is reporting around 8\" of new snow along with3\" of snow in Kyle Canyon, 4\" of snow in Rainbow Canyon and up to 1\" of snow in Anthem. Flakes were also flying in Summerlin with snow sticking in some neighborhoods in Henderson on the edges of town. Rainfall amounts in the valley were very light, measuring around a trace of showers up to .12\".{/p}{p}TODAY: Now that the showers have cleared out, we'll see gusty winds for the rest of the day. A WIND ADVISORY is in effect through 10am for sustained northwest winds 20-30 mph with wind gusts around 45 mph. As winds pick up, areas of blowing dust may be possible especially around construction sites. Breezes will very slowly back down throughout the rest of the day with high temperatures struggling to make it to 50 degrees in Las Vegas. The normal high temperature this time of the year is 58 degrees for some perspective.{/p}{p}Air and pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold around the freezing mark, 32 degrees. Temperatures may be a bit lower on the edges of town.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Much calmer on Friday with mostly sunny skies and valley highs in the low to mid 50s. Temperatures will keep climbing into the weekend as high pressure builds in with highs in the upper 50s by Sunday. A storm system will pass to our north but most of the impacts will be across Northern Nevada Saturday night into Sunday with the storm moving east. The latest storm tracks don't show much impact to Southern Nevada except additional clouds.{/p}{p}On Martin Luther King Jr. Day expect mostly sunny skies with light northeast winds up to 10 mph. 57 degrees by the afternoon.{/p}{p}Temperatures will be on the rise again through the work week with valley highs reaching the low 60s by Wednesday. There's some uncertainty over the weather pattern next week with an outside chance of showers possible late Wednesday... but the odds are around 10%....{/p}{p}In the extended forecast, valley high temperatures appear to stay in the low to mid 60s NEXT Thursday through Saturday.{/p}{p}Check back for Koast{/p}{p}A mayor in New York is calling for an investigation after {a href=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\" //13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\"}a man suffering a medical crisis was asked to leave an ambulance and later died{/a}.{/p}{p}Rochester Mayor Malik Evans held a news conference Thursday to discuss the incident, which happened Nov. 30. The city later released video of the incident.{/p}{p}The video appears to shows a man, who was having trouble breathing, being asked to leave one ambulance and wait on the street for another to arrive and take him to the hospital. The man falls to the sidewalk and waits more than two minutes before medical personnel helped him.{/p}{p}The man died shortly before Christmas, according to Evans, who said he didn't find out about the incident until Tuesday and was \"flabbergasted\" by it. He called on ambulance provider American Medical Response to conduct an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }Even though this was a medical scene, there are always lessons to be learned -- particularly as it relates to what type of ambulance services our medical services our community are experiencing,\" Evans said. \"City residents are people, and they deserve to be treated humanely and with the same attention as anyone else.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Police had been called to the ambulance for a reported assault against an EMT and were present when the man fell. Police Chief David Smith has also called for an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }I want to know why they chose to call the police,\" Evans said. \"I want to know why personnel required someone in distress to be removed from an ambulance instead of being taken directly to the hospital.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}In a statement, the city added AMR \"has committed to working to determine the reasons this incident occurred, address the gaps in the care that was provided to this patient, and fix whatever led to this unacceptable situation.\"{/p}{p}\"We must get to the bottom of this,\" Evans said. \"We must understand how and why this occurred and we must identify processes and safeguards to insure that this does not ever happen again.\"{/p}
